div.l: Wele was the wenche that with him myght slepe
And at euery brydale wolde he synge and hoppe
And loued bettyr the nethir ende than the shoppe
For when ther any rydyng was in chepe
Oute of the shoppe thider wolde he lepe
Tyl that he hadde alle the sight yseyn
And daunsed wele he wolde nat come ayen
And gadred him a menye of his sorte
To hoppe and syng and make suche disporte
And there they set steuene for to mete
To pleyen at the dyse in suche a strete
For in the toun was there no prentyse
That fayrer coude cast a peyre of dyse
Than Parkyn coude and therto he was fre
Of his dispence in place of pryuete
That fonde his maystere wele in his chaffare
For oftyme he fonde his box ful bare
For shortly a prentyce that is a reueloure
That hauntith dyce riotte and paramoure
His mayster shalle it in his shoppe abye
Al haue he no parte of the mynstralsye
For thift and riotte they been conuertible
Al can he pley on getern or rebyble
Reuel and trouthe as in a low degree
They be fulle wrothe alday as men may se
This ioly prentyce with his maystere stode
Tyl he was nigh oute of his prentyshode
Al were he snybbed bothe arely and late
And sumtyme ledde with reuel to Newgate
But at the last his mayster him bethought
Whan on a day whan he his paper sought
Vpon a prouerbe that sayeth this same worde
Wele bet is rottyn apul oute of horde
